docs.lead_paragraph: Only two years ago, Canadian online pharmacies were an emerging David thrashing at the multinational pharmaceutical Goliath, strengthened by soaring sales in the United States that ignited a lasting debate over high medicine prices. Now, just as quickly as it rose, the industry has been swamped by problems that have cut into sales and forced many of the smaller online pharmacies out of business.

headline.main: Kinks in Canada Drug Pipeline; A Host of Problems, Not Least the Medicare Prescription Plan

docs.snippet: The Canadian online pharmaceutical industry has been swamped by problems and many of the smaller companies have been forced out of business.

docs.lead_paragraph: Residents of Newark know Father Edwin Leahy as the headmaster of St. Benedict's Prep, the 132-year-old school that he resuscitated after its previous administrators decamped for the suburbs following the race riots of 1967.
docs.abstract: Residents of Newark know Father Edwin Leahy as the headmaster of St. Benedict's Prep, the 132-year-old school that he resuscitated after its previous administrators decamped for the suburbs following the race riots of 1967. Traditionally a bastion of academic excellence for generations of white Catholic immigrants, St. Benedict's today serves a student body of 550 [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Play hooky, disappear for the weekend, have a fling, binge-shop like a Wall Street divorcée. Spontaneity can be a healthy defiance of routine, an expression of starved desire, some psychologists say. Yet for scientists who study mental illness and addiction, impulsive behavior -- the tendency to act or react with little thought -- has emerged as an all-purpose plague.
docs.abstract: Janine D Flory, Mount Sinai School of Medicine psychologist, leads study to help explain how impulsive tendencies develop and what factors make people act destructively in certain situations; research, which is published in Journal of Psychiatric Research, connects activity in prefrontal areas of brain with impulsive behavior; finds that in humans impulsive actions peak during adolescent years; study may help doctors better understand addictive behaviors; drawing; photos (L)
docs.snippet: Researchers are beginning to identify why one person's spontaneity is another's descent into self-destruction.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British microbiologist was one of the first to warn that giving antibiotics to livestock could have dangerous consequences for humans.

headline.main: E. S. Anderson Dies at 94; Cautioned on Antibiotics
headline.print_headline: E. S. Anderson Dies at 94; Cautioned on Antibiotics
